lines.text: GTC
(iii) The Company has not received any notice signifying any non-compliance by the Company nor are any penalties or
strictures imposed on the Company by the Stock Exchange or SEBI or any statutory authority, on any matter related to
capital markets, during the last three years.
Means of Communication
Financial, Results
The quarterly/half-yearly/annual unaudited financial results of the Company are sent to the Stock Exchanges immediately
after they are approved by the Board of Directors.
b) No half yearly report was sent to the shareholders, however the same was published in the newspapers.
The quarterly unaudited financial results are normally published in the following newspapers: Free Press Journal and
Navshakti.
No presentation to any institutional investors or analysts has been made during the year ended 31s March, 2004.
(ii) Management Discussion and Analysis Report forms part of the Annual Report for the year ended 31s March, 2004.
VI Appointment/Reappointment of Directors
Shri A.K. Joshi was appointed as Additional Director and Whole-time director of the Company for a period of three years with
effect from 215 October, 2003. Shri Viney Mehra was re-appointed as Whole-time director of the Company with effect from 2nd
August, 2004 for a period of three years. The appointment of Shri A.K. Joshi and re-appointment of Shri Viney Mehra will be
confirmed by the shareholders in the forthcoming General Meeting. In accordance with the provisions of the Companies Act,
1956 and the Articles of Association of the Company Shri M.H. Patil will be liable to retire by rotation at the forthcoming Annual
General Meeting and is eligible for re-appointment. Following is the brief profile of the Directors:
Shri M. H. Patil
Shri M. H. Patil is Advocate by profession, practicing in the field of Central Excise, Customs & Allied matters. He holds a
Masters/Bachelors Degree in Law. Since over 15 years, he is heading Cen-Ex Services which is an organisation of the
Advocates & Consultants, in Central Excise, Customs and allied matters.
Shri A. K. Joshi
Shri A.K. Joshi was appointed for the first time as Whole-time Director of the Company with effect from 21 1 October, 2003 for
a period of three years. Besides being a graduate in Commerce, he is a Fellow member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants
of India.
Shri Viney Mehra
Shri Viney Mehra was appointed for a third term as a Whole-time Director of the Company for a period of three years with effect
from 2nd August, 2004. He has been serving the Company since last nineteen years and has played an important role in
modernisation of production, product quality enhancement, adopting innovative marketing strategies and developing the export
market for the products of the Company. After completion of his higher secondary education, he has done Advanced Diploma
in Production Engineering from Punjab Engineering College in Chandigarh. Before joining GTC Industries, he was in employment
of ITC Lid for a period of eighteen years.
I GTC Code for Prevention of Insider Trading
In accordance with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Prohibition of Insider Trading) Regulations, 1992, the Board of
Directors of the Company formulated the GTC Code of Conduct for Prevention of Insider Trading in the shares and securities
of the Company by its employees. The GTC Code, inter alia, prohibits purchase/sale of shares by employees, while in
possession of unpublished price sensitive information in relation to the Company. Shri Kamal K. Gupta, Vice President (Corporate
Affairs) & Secretary has been appointed as the Compliance Officer by the Board of Directors to implement the provisions of the
aforesaid Insider Trading Regulations
Ill General Shareholders Information
(i) 48th Annual General Meeting
The Annual General Meeting for the year ended 31 t March, 2004 is scheduled to be held on Friday, the 24" of September,
2004 at 3.00 p.m., at Shri Bhaidas Maganlal Sabhagriha, U-1, Juhu Development Scheme, Vile Parle (West), Mumbai -
